examples: We were scorned.

He said outright that he had scorn for humanity, he had no use for relationships.

examples: See full dictionary entry for heart.

examples: Waa-waa, the seesaw is not going anywhere.

words.defineVi: liên tục thay đổi từ ý kiến, trạng thái hoặc tâm trạng này sang ý kiến, trạng thái hoặc tâm trạng khác rồi quay lại

examples: So the therapy encourages better eating behaviors and it works on your self-image.

examples: Consumer sentiment has weakened significantly.

examples: The tall oak tree provided shade on a hot summer day.

examples: The dark clouds signaled that rain was on its way.

words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó để làm cho cảm xúc hoặc ý kiến của một người được biết đến

examples: And he sized up the response.

words.defineVi: để quan sát hoặc kiểm tra một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó để hình thành một bản án

examples: and most keyboards slant the number/hash sign from right to left.
But if the volar pad isn’t slanted when the ridges show up, then they’ll form a more symmetrical pattern.
She pursued her reporting with grace, intelligence and integrity, earning her the trust of countless Americans who counted on her to present the facts of the story without slant or spin.
But in chimps, the tibia slants diagonally outward, which suits their preferred mode of locomotion, called knucklewalking.
If the primary ridges, which are the earliest precursors of the ridges in fingerprints, form along that slant, they’ll make a loop.

examples: A stable relationship stands the test of time.

examples: A stable relationship stands the test of time.

examples: True friends will stand by you when the chips are down.

words.defineEn: to refuse to change one's opinions, attitudes, or decisions
words.defineVi: từ chối thay đổi ý kiến, thái độ, hoặc quyết định của một người

examples: From a purely mathematical standpoint, the annual contract makes the most sense.

examples: The journalist published a wrong statement in the article.

words.defineEn: something that is expressed through things one says or writes
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được thể hiện thông qua những điều người ta nói hoặc viết

words.defineVi: một bài kiểm tra ý kiến không chính thức bao gồm một số người đưa ra ý kiến của họ về điều gì đó hoặc nói liệu họ có ý định tham gia một cuộc bầu cử hay không

examples: Cobbled streets run down to a tiny harbor.
The new smartphone is streets ahead of its predecessor, with a larger screen and more powerful processor.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
The street vendor served crispy trotter bites with a tangy dipping sauce at the food market.
The protesters raised their cries for justice and equality in the streets.
words.defineEn: the ideas and opinions that ordinary people have, especially people who live in cities
words.defineVi: những ý tưởng và quan điểm mà những người bình thường có, đặc biệt là những người sống ở thành phố

examples: The German flag consists of three horizontal stripes: black, red, and gold.
So, maybe the stripes do something else!
That family's got a lot of stripes on.
Animals like tigers, okapi, angelfish, and certain hyenas all wear stripes, too, and /none/ of them are closely related in terms of evolution.
I'll be stripes.
words.defineEn: a distinct type, category, or opinion
words.defineVi: một loại, danh mục hoặc ý kiến riêng biệt

examples: I strongly believe that competition is a good thing.
The Irish economy is performing strongly, but the devil is in the detail.
This is something I feel strongly about.
She placed her hand over her heart and felt it beat strongly.
Local residents protested so strongly that plans for a new motorway fell by the wayside.
words.defineEn: in a forceful and persuasive manner
words.defineVi: một cách mạnh mẽ và thuyết phục

examples: And this disease has stubbornly resisted attempts at eradication.
Sexual assault remains stubbornly above 20,000 every year.
Young Tom here stubbornly refuses to say a word about it, so I need you to say if her story is true or not.'
No matter what we do, the past is always, stubbornly, behind us.
But the sexism that permeated early science and remains stubbornly common was perhaps the biggest obstacle.
words.defineEn: in a manner that shows a person's resistance or unwillingness to reconsider what they think or want to do
words.defineVi: theo cách thể hiện sự phản kháng của một người hoặc không muốn xem xét lại những gì họ nghĩ hoặc muốn làm

examples: The last delusion in this quadrad of delusions, is subjective doubles.
But questionnaires are still subjective.
It's so subjective.
- It's too subjective.
Because that's subjective.
words.defineEn: based on or influenced by personal feelings or opinions rather than facts
words.defineVi: dựa trên hoặc bị ảnh hưởng bởi cảm xúc hoặc ý kiến cá nhân hơn là sự thật

examples: They can only be subjectively perceived.
Well, subjectively, I don't know.
It helps you down shift from being hyped up and worked up to feeling subjectively more relaxed.
There are several studies that show, subjectively at least, that sleeping with a weighted blanket helps people feel less anxious.
words.defineEn: in a way that is only based on or influenced by one’s personal opinions, ideas, or feelings
words.defineVi: theo cách chỉ dựa trên hoặc bị ảnh hưởng bởi ý kiến, ý tưởng hoặc cảm xúc cá nhân của một người

words.defineEn: to talk about someone who is absent in a mean way
words.defineVi: để nói về một người vắng mặt một cách có ý nghĩa

examples: The voice behind all of these narratives is a white male subjectivity.
There's some subjectivity here to determine what's out of proportion.
Some contemporary thinkers aren't interested in sadness' subjectivity versus universality, and would rather use technology to eliminate suffering in all its forms.
In sociology, we talk about subjectivity as the meaning that people give their own lived experiences.

Some combination of the two probably is where we are headed for the future, some hybrid type of situation, where you can lean into kind of the execution, the ease of use from a technological perspective, and also balancing that with a human adviser that can offer you a little bit more engagement, the subjectivity, that I think a lot of investors are looking for.
words.defineEn: the state of being affected by personal opinions and feelings instead of facts and statistics
words.defineVi: tình trạng bị ảnh hưởng bởi ý kiến và cảm xúc cá nhân thay vì sự thật và số liệu thống kê

words.defineEn: a phrase or word that intentionally conveys two distinct meanings, usually with one sexual connotation
words.defineVi: một cụm từ hoặc từ cố ý truyền đạt hai ý nghĩa riêng biệt, thường là với một ý nghĩa tình dục
